main event: On September 10, 1968, two civilian pilots observed a bright light performing acrobatics near Ocala, Florida, for about 15 minutes before it rapidly disappeared.
interesting points: The pilots described the object making sharp turns and climbing quickly, suggesting it exhibited unusual flight characteristics not typical of known aircraft., Jacksonville Center could not track the object on radar., At one point, the object appeared directly over Ocala before veering off quickly., Both pilots were initially unsure of what they saw but acknowledged it couldn't have been a conventional aircraft due to its maneuvers., The sighting included a near-collision course, causing significant alarm to the pilots.
sighted object: a bright light performing aerial maneuvers
witness description: civilian pilots, one of whom had over 8000 flying hours
